snippet: In a study, the United States finished last out of 11 advanced nations, despite having the most costly system in the world.
abstract: Editorial examines Commonwealth Fund analysis finding that the United States ranks last among 11 advanced nations in terms of the quality and efficiency of its health care system; argues that Affordable Care Act remains best way to address the disparity, and that Congressional Republicans should allow it to accomplish its goals.
lead_paragraph: In a study, the United States finished last out of 11 advanced nations, despite having the most costly system in the world.

headline.main: How Health Care Systems Stack Up
headline.print_headline: How Health Care Systems Stack Up

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
